<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIG TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/big-tech-reports-big-tech-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Today's Special Is Ginormous Numbers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Big Tech under the antitrust spotlight" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODIzL2JpZ190ZWNoX3VuZGVyX3RoZV9hbnRpdHJ1c3Rfc3BvdGxpZ2h0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After the bell yesterday, four Big Tech bigwigs dispatched earnings reports. Taking a page from many of their product strategies, we've bundled up the main points for you below. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Apple</strong> posted <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/29/apple-aapl-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong numbers</a> for its fiscal Q4 that modestly beat expectations, with Macs and AirPods offsetting weaker iPhone sales. But it didn't offer guidance for next quarter, so investors don't know what to expect for the just-released iPhone 12. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The context: Apple has worked on shoring up its software and services, plus it’s boosted products like AirPods and the Apple Watch. Its hyped Apple One bundle, which combines several services, </span><span><a href="https://9to5mac.com/2020/10/29/apple-one-bundle-tomorrow/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launches</a></span><span> today. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Amazon</strong> <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/29/business/us-economy-coronavirus#amazons-profits-keep-surging-during-the-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made expectations</a> wish they were never born; sales increased 37% yearly to $96.1 billion and profits jumped almost 200%. And that doesn't even include Prime Day. <em>And</em> Amazon has been spending big on warehouses and delivery infrastructure. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The context: The pandemic has boosted Amazon's e-commerce business, but its advertising and cloud computing segments are in fine form, too. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Google </strong>parent Alphabet also reported blowout earnings, with profits at $11.2 billion and revenue at $46 billion last quarter. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The context: It looks like Google </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-alphabet-googl-3q-earnings-report-2020-11603988595?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recovered</a></span><span> from its first-ever revenue dip in Q2. But astronomical advertising revenue doesn't exactly bode well for </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/us-dept-justice-files-landmark-antitrust-case-google?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">its fight</a></span><span> against the DOJ's antitrust allegations. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Facebook </strong><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/29/facebook-fb-earnings-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat expectations</a> on both revenue ($21.5 billion) and daily active users (1.8+ billion, up 12% yearly). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The context: Optics-wise, Facebook has had a tough 2020, with magnified scrutiny over its handling of political content and advertising. But numbers-wise, it's done well—last quarter, it officially reached 3 billion monthly users across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Earnings season ain’t over yet, but these four plus Microsoft account for 46% of the Nasdaq 100. That predominance in the stock market, plus the growing criticism over their market power, means they’re watched magnifier-closely. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/us-gdp-rose-74-quarterly-basis-q3?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Blockbuster Q3 GDP Has a Big But
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A graph showing inflation-adjusted U.S. GDP. The chart begins in Q1 2017 at $18T, then steadily increases to around $19T in Q1 2020. There is a sudden drop in Q2 to <$17.5T, followed by a sharp bounce back up in Q3 to $18.5T+" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTcxL3EzX2dkcC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Commerce Department <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/10/29/928797051/u-s-economy-grows-at-record-pace-but-still-has-a-long-way-to-go?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted grades</a> for the U.S.' second ECON-19 midterm. How'd it do? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Q3 GDP* grew at a record annualized rate** of 33.1% from July–August.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">*GDP: </strong></span><span>the value of all goods and services produced in the economy.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">**Annualized rate:</strong></span><span> measured as if the economy will continue growing at that pace for a full year. That's important to distinguish because during Q3, the U.S. reopened the economy after a once-in-a-century pandemic (<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/hand-with-index-and-middle-fingers-crossed_1f91e.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">) shut everything down. Not the kind of thing you do multiple quarters in a row. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On a quarter-to-quarter basis, Q3 GDP rose 7.4%, following a 9% drop in Q2. Overall, GDP is down 3.5% this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Economists were expecting a rebound following Q2's record drop in economic output. But it's still been an uneven recovery with room to improve: Only <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-gdp-third-quarter-2020-11603908566?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">half</a> the 22 million jobs lost in March and April have been recovered.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>growth is expected to continue in Q4, albeit more slowly. But the third wave of Covid infections and the lack of federal stimulus could be a drag on those numbers.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/netflix-raises-price-standard-premium-subscriptions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix's Queen’s Gambit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Netflix <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/29/21540346/netflix-price-increase-united-states-standard-premium-content-product-features?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> its first price hike in nearly two years. The damage: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>+$1 on the standard plan, now $13.99/month</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>+$2 on the premium tier, now $17.99</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>No change to the basic plan, $8.99</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Okay, maybe this won't tank the bank, but it's a big deal. Netflix is expected to pass 200 million subscribers this year, and those dollars add up. Shares rose 3.7% following the news.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reasoning: </strong>Every year, Netflix invests more money in pumping out original content (did you see <em>Holidate</em>?). Execs think that value for customers is worth a pricier subscription.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More original content = a better arsenal for Netflix to fend off a growing list of competitors, including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Disney+</strong></span><span>, which is nearing its 1-year anniversary with 60+ million subscribers and a new season of </span><span><em>The</em></span><span> </span><span><em>Mandalorian </em></span><span>out today. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">WarnerMedia's HBO Max</strong></span><span>, which parent company AT&T </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/22/21528234/hbo-max-subscribers-activations-att-directv-warner?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> has 57 million global subscribers. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">NBCUniversal's Peacock</strong></span><span>, which </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/29/21539909/peacock-22-million-users-comcast-q3-2020-earnings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collected</a></span><span> nearly 22 million users after three months. (Parent Comcast hasn't disclosed how many are paying.)  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's just the streaming platforms. Netflix is also competing in the eyeball economy against the likes of YouTube, TikTok, Twitch, and even your REM schedule. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY UBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You, The Election, And a Lot of Questions
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.ubs.com/us/en/wealth-management/election-watch-2020.html?campID=SOME-EW2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-PRIMARY-ANY-ANY-20201030-TEXTONLY-ALLFOLLOWERS-PAID%20" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="UBS" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTUwOC8xNjAzODk3ODY1LVNvbGl0YV9Tb2NpYWwtSW1hZ2VfMTAxMng1ODAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We don’t need to get into all the reasons why 2020 has been a year unlike any other—it goes without saying.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the biggest thing on everybody’s mind right now is: Who will lead the U.S.?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The election is around the corner, and with it comes an abundance of questions on what it means for the markets and your portfolio. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To help answer these questions, <a href="https://www.ubs.com/us/en/wealth-management/election-watch-2020/investor-insights.html?campID=SOME-EW2020-GLOBAL-ENG-MORNINGBREW-NEWSLETTER-IWPULSE-PRIMARY-20201030-SHAREDLINK-ALLFOLLOWERS-ORGANIC" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UBS</a> has conducted independent research to gauge <a href="https://www.ubs.com/us/en/wealth-management/election-watch-2020/investor-insights.html?campID=SOME-EW2020-GLOBAL-ENG-MORNINGBREW-NEWSLETTER-IWPULSE-PRIMARY-20201030-SHAREDLINK-ALLFOLLOWERS-ORGANIC" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investor sentiment around the election</a>. They learned:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Investors are split on who they are voting for (51% Biden vs. 49% Trump).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 50% of investors plan to make portfolio changes regardless of who wins.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Investors say the biggest issue in this election is the economy (89%).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With these stats in mind, <a href="https://www.ubs.com/us/en/wealth-management/election-watch-2020.html?campID=SOME-EW2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-PRIMARY-ANY-ANY-20201030-TEXTONLY-ALLFOLLOWERS-PAID" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UBS</a> created their five-part virtual <a href="https://www.ubs.com/us/en/wealth-management/election-watch-2020.html?campID=SOME-EW2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-PRIMARY-ANY-ANY-20201030-TEXTONLY-ALLFOLLOWERS-PAID" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UBS Election Watch series</a> where UBS experts and policymakers—including Jennifer Granholm, Nikki Haley, and Karen Hughes—provide insights into how potential outcomes of the election could impact you as an investor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.ubs.com/us/en/wealth-management/election-watch-2020.html?campID=SOME-EW2020-US-ENG-MORNINGBREW-PRIMARY-ANY-ANY-20201030-TEXTONLY-ALLFOLLOWERS-PAID" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Watch highlights of the entire series right here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/pennsylvania-2020-election-frackstory?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pennsylvania in 2020: The Frackstory
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A drilling rig in Pennsylvania " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTc0L2RyaWxsaW5nX3JpZ19wZW5uc3lsdmFuaWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Robert Nickelsberg/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This article is part of our weeklong series exploring state-level issues in the upcoming election. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Right now, the Trump and Biden campaigns <a href="https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-pennsylvania-elections-c28fbf9d921915f3a65c01e6c4cebcf6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are all over</a> the commonwealth of Pennsylvania like Sheetzes and Yuengling taps. It's a swing state that boasts 20 electoral votes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>President Trump won Pennsylvania in 2016, but by only 44,292 votes...which wouldn't fill Lincoln Financial Field. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Biden is </span><span><a href="https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/pennsylvania/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">currently favored</a></span><span> to win the state, per FiveThirtyEight.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Biden's strategy:</strong> hitting on <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/biden-fracking-unions-pennsylvania/2020/10/22/447d31de-12cf-11eb-ad6f-36c93e6e94fb_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">broad economic themes</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trump's: </strong>claiming dubiously that Biden would ban fracking. Biden has pledged to ban fracking on federal lands and offshore, not overall. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's fracking again? </strong>When a drilling company injects a high-pressure water mixture into a rock formation to release gas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why Trump is so focused on it: </strong>Pennsylvania <a href="https://www.abc27.com/news/fracking-long-important-in-pennsylvania-accompanies-the-states-rise-in-national-electoral-prominence/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">produces</a> ~25% of the U.S.' natural gas that comes from fracking. It's been an economic savior for some parts of the state that were hollowed out by the decline of manufacturing jobs, but some Pennsylvanians are against it on environmental grounds. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Fracking really isn't top-of-mind for the majority of Pennsylvania voters. But campaign strategists say that in a state where the race is so close, an issue that can even slightly tip the scales is significant. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Miss any of our state-level stories this week? </strong>Here they are: The states voting on <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/pot-legalization-5-states-toke-issue?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">marijuana legalization</a>, California's expensive <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/26/uber-lyft-spending-big-prop-22?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Prop 22</a>, Texas's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/27/texass-economic-makeover-will-make-election-day-interesting?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urban renaissance</a>, and Wisconsin's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/28/trumps-promises-wisconsin-manufacturing-workers-disappoint?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Foxconn debacle</a>. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/business-insider-buys-controlling-stake-morning-brew?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Have You Heard of This Shop?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Morning Brew on a smartphone next to a cup of espresso " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTc3L21vcm5pbmdfYnJldy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Morning Brew</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Word is they're worth some $$$ and everyone who underestimated them in high school has egg all over their face. Yesterday, Insider Inc., parent of Business Insider, said it's buying a controlling stake in digital media startup Morning Brew at a reported valuation of up to $75 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why the Brew was attractive</strong>: Morning Brew expects to bring in $20+ million in revenue this year, has been consistently profitable, and has incredibly good-looking newsletter writers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Its products include a daily email with ~2.5 million readers, three industry-specific newsletters read by 500,000 subscribers, a new lifestyle newsletter, and a podcast, </span><span><em>Business Casual</em></span><span>, that's notched 6 million downloads. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why Insider was an attractive buyer:</strong> Morning Brew cofounders Alex Lieberman and Austin Rief said they were drawn to Insider's "history of welcoming entrepreneurs with open arms and empowering them to build their businesses independently." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To that point, Insider's not messing with the Brew's popular brand and will keep it as an independent entity.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While the broader digital news media is struggling in a landscape dominated by tech behemoths, Morning Brew found success by building strong relationships in one of the most underappreciated places: the email inbox. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The feeling of getting a 5/5 on the Brew's Weekly <span class="il">News</span> <span class="il">Quiz</span> has been compared to cutting open a perfectly ripe avocado.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's that satisfying. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/brews-weekly-news-quiz-october-30?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ace the quiz</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Election Lite: </strong>Guess who voted for Biden or Trump by <a href="https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1321450929703555075?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looking inside</a> their fridges, and geek out over Google <a href="https://waves-of-interest.truth-and-beauty.net/#US?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">search trends</a> by analyzing the most-searched terms this election. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow Friday: </strong>Ranked in order from least to most spooky, follow <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@ghosthoney?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ghosthoney</a> on TikTok, <a href="https://twitter.com/DothTheDoth?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Doth</a> on Twitter, <a href="https://www.instagram.com/trevorhenderson/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Trevor Henderson</a> on Instagram, and the infamous subreddit: <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/nosleep/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nosleep</a>. </p>

Hopes for a spike in demand are drying up as people start to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-prices-hammered-by-lockdown-driven-demand-fears-11603975955?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehunker down\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for this tough pandemic winter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith earnings season hitting its apex, stocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/28/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebounced back\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from their Wednesday plunge. Positive economic data reports (record GDP growth, lower jobless claims) helped. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nBIG TECH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/29/big-tech-reports-big-tech-earnings?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nToday's Special Is Ginormous Numbers\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Big Tech under the antitrust spotlight\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODIzL2JpZ190ZWNoX3VuZGVyX3RoZV9hbnRpdHJ1c3Rfc3BvdGxpZ2h0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter the bell yesterday, four Big Tech bigwigs dispatched earnings reports. Taking a page from many of their product strategies, we've bundled up the main points for you below. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple\u003c/strong\u003e posted \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/29/apple-aapl-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrong numbers\u003c/a\u003e for its fiscal Q4 that modestly beat expectations, with Macs and AirPods offsetting weaker iPhone sales. But it didn't offer guidance for next quarter, so investors don't know what to expect for the just-released iPhone 12. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe context: Apple has worked on shoring up its software and services, plus it’s boosted products like AirPods and the Apple Watch. Its hyped Apple One bundle, which combines several services, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://9to5mac.com/2020/10/29/apple-one-bundle-tomorrow/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunches\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e today. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/29/business/us-economy-coronavirus#amazons-profits-keep-surging-during-the-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade expectations\u003c/a\u003e wish they were never born; sales increased 37% yearly to $96.1 billion and profits jumped almost 200%. And that doesn't even include Prime Day. \u003cem\u003eAnd\u003c/em\u003e Amazon has been spending big on warehouses and delivery infrastructure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe context: The pandemic has boosted Amazon's e-commerce business, but its advertising and cloud computing segments are in fine form, too. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGoogle \u003c/strong\u003eparent Alphabet also reported blowout earnings, with profits at $11.2 billion and revenue at $46 billion last quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe context: It looks like Google \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-alphabet-googl-3q-earnings-report-2020-11603988595?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecovered\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from its first-ever revenue dip in Q2. But astronomical advertising revenue doesn't exactly bode well for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/us-dept-justice-files-landmark-antitrust-case-google?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eits fight\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e against the DOJ's antitrust allegations. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/29/facebook-fb-earnings-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeat expectations\u003c/a\u003e on both revenue ($21.5 billion) and daily active users (1.8+ billion, up 12% yearly). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe context: Optics-wise, Facebook has had a tough 2020, with magnified scrutiny over its handling of political content and advertising. But numbers-wise, it's done well—last quarter, it officially reached 3 billion monthly users across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eEarnings season ain’t over yet, but these four plus Microsoft account for 46% of the Nasdaq 100. That predominance in the stock market, plus the growing criticism over their market power, means they’re watched magnifier-closely. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable There is a sudden drop in Q2 to \u003c$17.5T, followed by a sharp bounce back up in Q3 to $18.5T+\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTcxL3EzX2dkcC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Commerce Department \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/10/29/928797051/u-s-economy-grows-at-record-pace-but-still-has-a-long-way-to-go?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eposted grades\u003c/a\u003e for the U.S.' second ECON-19 midterm. How'd it do? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQ3 GDP* grew at a record annualized rate** of 33.1% from July–August.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e*GDP: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe value of all goods and services produced in the economy.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e**Annualized rate:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e measured as if the economy will continue growing at that pace for a full year. That's important to distinguish because during Q3, the U.S. reopened the economy after a once-in-a-century pandemic (\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/hand-with-index-and-middle-fingers-crossed_1f91e.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e) shut everything down. Not the kind of thing you do multiple quarters in a row. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn a quarter-to-quarter basis, Q3 GDP rose 7.4%, following a 9% drop in Q2. Overall, GDP is down 3.5% this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEconomists were expecting a rebound following Q2's record drop in economic output. But it's still been an uneven recovery with room to improve: Only \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-gdp-third-quarter-2020-11603908566?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalf\u003c/a\u003e the 22 million jobs lost in March and April have been recovered.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003egrowth is expected to continue in Q4, albeit more slowly. But the third wave of Covid infections and the lack of federal stimulus could be a drag on those numbers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/29/21540346/netflix-price-increase-united-states-standard-premium-content-product-features?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e its first price hike in nearly two years. The damage: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e+$1 on the standard plan, now $13.99/month\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e+$2 on the premium tier, now $17.99\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNo change to the basic plan, $8.99\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOkay, maybe this won't tank the bank, but it's a big deal. Netflix is expected to pass 200 million subscribers this year, and those dollars add up. Shares rose 3.7% following the news.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reasoning: \u003c/strong\u003eEvery year, Netflix invests more money in pumping out original content (did you see \u003cem\u003eHolidate\u003c/em\u003e?). Execs think that value for customers is worth a pricier subscription.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore original content = a better arsenal for Netflix to fend off a growing list of competitors, including...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDisney+\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which is nearing its 1-year anniversary with 60+ million subscribers and a new season of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eMandalorian \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eout today. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWarnerMedia's HBO 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eRobert Nickelsberg/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis article is part of our weeklong series exploring state-level issues in the upcoming election. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRight now, the Trump and Biden campaigns \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-pennsylvania-elections-c28fbf9d921915f3a65c01e6c4cebcf6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare all over\u003c/a\u003e the commonwealth of Pennsylvania like Sheetzes and Yuengling taps. It's a swing state that boasts 20 electoral votes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump won Pennsylvania in 2016, but by only 44,292 votes...which wouldn't fill Lincoln Financial Field. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBiden is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/pennsylvania/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecurrently favored\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to win the state, per FiveThirtyEight.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBiden's strategy:\u003c/strong\u003e hitting on \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/biden-fracking-unions-pennsylvania/2020/10/22/447d31de-12cf-11eb-ad6f-36c93e6e94fb_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebroad economic themes\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrump's: \u003c/strong\u003eclaiming dubiously that Biden would ban fracking. Biden has pledged to ban fracking on federal lands and offshore, not overall. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's fracking again? \u003c/strong\u003eWhen a drilling company injects a high-pressure water mixture into a rock formation to release gas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy Trump is so focused on it: \u003c/strong\u003ePennsylvania \u003ca href=\"https://www.abc27.com/news/fracking-long-important-in-pennsylvania-accompanies-the-states-rise-in-national-electoral-prominence/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproduces\u003c/a\u003e ~25% of the U.S.' natural gas that comes from fracking. It's been an economic savior for some parts of the state that were hollowed out by the decline of manufacturing jobs, but some Pennsylvanians are against it on environmental grounds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFracking really isn't top-of-mind for the majority of Pennsylvania voters. But campaign strategists say that in a state where the race is so close, an issue that can even slightly tip the scales is significant. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWord is they're worth some $$$ and everyone who underestimated them in high school has egg all over their face. Yesterday, Insider Inc., parent of Business Insider, said it's buying a controlling stake in digital media startup Morning Brew at a reported valuation of up to $75 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy the Brew was attractive\u003c/strong\u003e: Morning Brew expects to bring in $20+ million in revenue this year, has been consistently profitable, and has incredibly good-looking newsletter writers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIts products include a daily email with ~2.5 million readers, three industry-specific newsletters read by 500,000 subscribers, a new lifestyle newsletter, and a podcast, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eBusiness Casual\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, that's notched 6 million downloads. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy Insider was an attractive buyer:\u003c/strong\u003e Morning Brew cofounders Alex Lieberman and Austin Rief said they were drawn to Insider's \"history of welcoming entrepreneurs with open arms and empowering them to build their businesses independently.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo that point, Insider's not messing with the Brew's popular brand and will keep it as an independent entity.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile the broader digital news media is struggling in a landscape dominated by tech behemoths, Morning Brew found success by building strong relationships in one of the most underappreciated places: the email inbox. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
